page.title: 12FIELD STUDY CENTRES
page.content: FORD CASTLE FIELD STUDY CENTRE On weekdays the Castle at Ford is now used as a field study centre,part of the Outdoor Education Service serving schools from Northumberland, Newcastle and North Tyneside L.E.A. Over 1800 children ,mainly 14-18 years old,stay at the castle in a year and undertake field work in mainly Geography,Biology and Environmental Studies. The wide range of habitats,historical sites and areas of geographical interest close to the castle, from coast to mountains,and the layout of the castle buildings make it ideally suited for use as a field study centre.At weekends the Castle is used as a residential venue for in-service training courses and conferences for Northumberland's teachers.1500 adults stay every year.
